oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Eddy Arnold - Parts 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Eddy Arnold (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 1, 2 and 3. Recording is from an unknown date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Eddy Arnold
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Cattle Call [excerpt] (Eddy Arnold) -- (00:39) Ralph Emery lists the accolades of Arnold and both discuss Homer and Jethro addressing Arnold -- (02:49) Emery inquires about Arnold's early comical career and Pee Wee King's contribution to Arnold joining the Grand Ole Opry -- (05:10) Emery pushes Arnold to discuss Bing Crosby's contribution to country music -- (07:32) Anytime [excerpt] (Eddy Arnold) -- (07:42) Emery invites Arnold to reflect on why he decided to become a solo artist -- (09:30) Emery and Arnold discuss how Arnold wound up becoming a member of RCA during a musician's strike -- (12:54) Emery and Arnold discuss when Arnold was first able to release a record in 1944 -- (15:24) Emery invites Arnold to discuss his string of hits following "That's How Much I Love you" -- (16:24) Emery inquires why Arnold chose "Cattle Call" as his theme song -- (17:49) Arnold and Emery discuss how Arnold used to record in Chicago and New York where he eventually met Frank Walker -- (22:39) Emery asks Arnold to recall the six songs to reach the top ten -- (24:37) Bouquet of Roses [excerpt] (Eddy Arnold) -- (25:02) King addresses his time playing with Arnold -- (25:26) Emery invites Arnold to reflect on a time where people declared the Grand Ole Opry was what made Arnold famous -- (29:44) Tennessee Stud [excerpt] (Eddy Arnold) -- (29:52) Emery inquires why Arnold decided to part ways with Colonel Tom Parker -- (31:36) Emery questions which television show was Arnold's first, and Arnold reveals it to be the Milton Berle Show -- (32:49) Arnold discusses how he met Ginger Rogers while hosting the Tonight Show and peoples conception of himself -- (36:20) That's How Much I Love You [excerpt] (Eddy Arnold) -- (36:33) Emery invites Arnold to discuss his family and the details of his marriage to Sally Gayhart -- (39:42) Emery inquires why "I Really Don't Want to Know" is Arnold's favorite song -- (41:53) Make the World Go Away [excerpt] (Eddy Arnold) -- (42:06) Arnold invites Arnold to discuss how he became a member of the Country Music Hall of Fame before becoming an Entertainer of the Year -- (44:04) Emery questions who Arnold enjoys from the younger country artists, and both say goodbye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008;
